solution.text:
The given equation, \(y = _{k}_\) has no dependency on x (ie - it has the same value regardless of the value taken by x).
Therefore, the value of y remains equal to _{k}_ for the entire range of x values and it can thus be represented as a line parallel to the x axis intercepting the y axis at y = _{k}_.

content.text: Select the correct geometric representation of the equation \(y = _{k}_\) in TWO variables.
